posts.post_content:
I don't think it's that bad. It's virtually unblockable, and in black, that's quite valuable. Plus, black is rife with ways to take advantage of near-unblockability.  
  
On top of all that, it's got wicked art.

Posted By: Kryptnyt (4/17/2012 9:29:35 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Creepy art and flavor... pretty bad card (and a rare, no less!) It seems that the designers of Ice Age were pants-crappingly afraid of evasion, not realizing that they put stuff like Incinerate, Dark Banishing and Swords to freakin' Plowshares- very effective removal, in the same set! It's really funny to see how creatures have just gotten so much better in modern Magic- a good thing, in my opinion. If you have good removal, I see no problem with making strong creatures.
posts.html:
